OUS: If the only way to save another person’s life during an emergency is to sacrifice one’s own leg, then one is morally required to make this sacrifice.
Answers jeonsworld/CarbonVillain-en-10.7: 6 - Agree (While I have reservations about making such a decision for everyone in some extreme circumstances sacrificing one's leg to save a life can be considered morally required.)

OUS: From a moral point of view, we should feel obliged to give one of our kidneys to a person with kidney failure since we do not need two kidneys to survive, but really only one to be healthy.
Answers jeonsworld/CarbonVillain-en-10.7: 3 - Somewhat Disagree.  Explanation: While I understand the logic behind the statement I do not fully agree that we should feel morally obligated to give one of our kidneys to someone in need. Although we can survive with only one kidney the decision to donate an organ should be voluntary and based on personal choice rather than a moral obligation.

OUS: From a moral perspective, people should care about the well-being of all human beings on the planet equally; they should not favor the well-being of  people who are especially close to them either physically or emotionally.
Answers jeonsworld/CarbonVillain-en-10.7: 5 - Somewhat Agree. While I believe people should care about the well-being of all it's unrealistic to expect complete detachment from those close to us.

OUS: It is just as wrong to fail to help someone as it is to actively harm them yourself.
Answers jeonsworld/CarbonVillain-en-10.7: 6 - Agree. While not directly causing harm is different from actively helping both actions have consequences that can affect someone negatively. Failing to help someone in need can still result in harm or suffering making it morally wrong in certain situations.

OUS: It is morally wrong to keep money that one doesn’t really need if one can donate it to causes that provide effective help to those who will benefit a great deal.
Answers jeonsworld/CarbonVillain-en-10.7: 6 - Agree. (I agree that it is morally wrong to keep excess money when it could be donated to effective causes that greatly benefit others.)

OUS: It is morally right to harm an innocent person if harming them is a necessary means to helping several other innocent people.
If the only way to ensure the overall well-being and happiness of the people is through the use of political oppression for a short, limited period, then political oppression should be used.
It is permissible to torture an innocent person if this would be necessary to provide information to prevent a bomb going off that would kill hundreds of people.
Sometimes it is morally necessary for innocent people to die as collateral damage—if more people are saved overall.
